main event: A round object, disc shaped and the size of a quarter, with the appearance of a light bulb and trailing smoke was observed for 2-3 minutes before fading out in Inwood, Long Island, New York on 7 November 1957. The observation was made by a civilian named [REDACTED] Lane.
interesting points: The object was described as disc shaped, the size of a quarter, and had the appearance of a light bulb.
It was observed trailing smoke and eventually faded out of sight.
The sighting lasted for 2-3 minutes, providing ample time for observation.
The observer was a civilian, which adds credibility to the report.
The observation took place in Inwood, Long Island, New York.
sighted object: round object, disc shaped, size of a quarter, appearance of a light bulb, trailing smoke
